isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - Specifications - Adjustments and Specifications

svcsubproc.title: Drive Pinion Bearings - Preload
svcsubproc.para: Specification: New bearings - 5 to 45 in-lbs. (0.56 to 5.08 Nm) torque. Used bearings in good condition - 10 to 30 in-lbs. (1.1 to 3.4 Nm) torque
Adjustment: Preload is controlled by the thickness of the spacer between bearing cones. To increase preload, install a thinner spacer. To decrease preload, install a thicker spacer.

svcsubproc.title: Drive Pinion - Depth in Carrier
svcsubproc.para: Specification: Install the correct amount of shims between the inner bearing cup of the drive pinion and the carrier. To calculate, use the old shim pack thickness and the new and old pinion cone numbers.
Adjustment: Change the thickness of the shim pack to get a good gear tooth contact pattern.

svcsubproc.title: Hypoid Gear Set - Tooth Contact Patterns (Hand-Rolled)
svcsubproc.para: Specification: Toward the toe of the gear tooth and in the center between the top and bottom of the tooth.

Adjustment: Tooth contact patterns are controlled by the thickness of the shim pack between the inner bearing cone of the drive pinion and the carrier and by ring gear backlash. To move the contact pattern lower, increase the thickness of the shim pack between the inner bearing cup of the drive pinion and the carrier. To move the contact pattern higher, decrease the thickness of the shim pack between the inner bearing cup of the drive pinion and the carrier. To move the contact pattern toward the toe of the tooth, decrease backlash of the ring gear. To move the contact pattern toward the heel of the tooth, increase backlash of the ring gear.

svcsubproc.title: Main Differential Bearings - Preload
svcsubproc.para: Specification: 15 to 35 in-lbs. (1.7 to 3.9 Nm) torque OR Expansion between bearing caps - 0.003 to 0.009 inch (0.08 to 0.22 mm) - 140 and 145 Series. 0.006 to 0.013 inch (0.15 to 0.33 mm) - 160 Series.
Adjustment: Preload is controlled by tightening both adjusting rings after zero end play is reached.

svcsubproc.title: Main Differential Bearings - Rotating Resistance
svcsubproc.para: Specification: 50 ft-lbs. (68 Nm) maximum torque applied to one side gear

svcsubproc.title: Output Bearing - End Play and Preload
svcsubproc.para: Specification: 0.001 to 0.004 inch (0.025 to 0.102 mm) bearing end play
Adjustment: End play is controlled by the size of the snap ring in the output bearing cage. Increase end play by installing a thinner snap ring. Decrease end play by installing a thicker snap ring.

note.para: If the end play on the output bearing measures zero (0), a thinner snap ring is required.

svcsubproc.title: Ring Gear - Backlash

item.para: 145 Series: Range: 0.008 to 0.018 inch (0.020 to 0.46 mm). Backlash Setting for New Gear Sets: 0.012 inch (0.30 mm).
160 Series: Range: 0.010 to 0.020 inch (0.025 to 0.51 mm). Backlash Setting for New Gear Sets: 0.012 inch (0.30 mm).

svcsubproc.para: Adjustment: Backlash is controlled by the position of the ring gear. Change backlash within specifications to get a good tooth contact pattern. To increase backlash, move the ring gear away from the drive pinion. To decrease backlash, move the ring gear toward the drive pinion.

svcsubproc.title: Sensor Switch - Installation (Carriers with Differential Lock Only)
svcsubproc.para: Adjustment: Shift the differential to the locked position. Tighten the sensor switch into the carrier until the test light illuminates. Tighten the sensor switch one additional turn. Tighten the jam nut to the specified torque.
